Shanty towns are mostly found in developing nations, or partially developed nations with an [[economic inequality|unequal distribution of wealth]] (or, on occasion, developed countries in a severe recession). In extreme cases, shanty towns have populations approaching that of a city. {{asof|2005}}, one billion people, one-sixth of the world's population, live in shanty towns.<ref>David Whitehouse, [http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/science/nature/4561183.stm "Half of humanity set to go urban"], BBC News, May 19, 2005.</ref>
